questions.Name: Which type of change is MOST LIKELY to be initiated as part of the 'service request management' practice?
Which can act as an operating model for an organization?

Options.Name: The four dimensions of service management

questions.Name: Which practice recommends the use of event-based surveys to gather feedback from customers?

Identify the missing word in the following sentence. 
A service is a means of enabling value co-creation by facilitating ? that customers want to achieve, without the customer having to manage specific costs and risks.
Which practice has a purpose that includes managing risks to confidentiality, integrity and availability?
Which will help solve incidents more quickly?

Options.Name: Escalating all incidents to support teams
Detailed procedural steps for incident investigation

questions.Name: What is the MAIN benefit of 'problem management'?

Options.Name: Restoring normal service as quickly as possible
Reducing the number and impact of incidents
Maximizing the number of successful changes

questions.Name: Which is an activity of the 'problem management' practice?

Options.Name: Restoration of normal service operation as quickly as possible
Prioritization of problems based on the risk that they pose
Authorization of changes to resolve the cause of problems
Resolution of incidents in a time that meets customer expectations

questions.Name: What can be used to determine if a service is 'fit for purpose'?
In service relationships, what is a benefit of identifying consumer roles?

Options.Name: It removes constraints from the customer
It enables a common definition of value

questions.Name: Which statement about managing incidents is CORRECT?

Options.Name: Low impact incidents should be resolved efficiently, making logging unnecessary
The 'incident management' practice should use a single process regardless of the impact of the incident
Low impact incidents should be resolved efficiently so the resource required is reduced
Incidents with the lowest impact should be resolved first

questions.Name: Which statement about the service value chain is CORRECT?

Options.Name: The service value chain converts value into demand
Each value chain activity uses different combinations of practices to convert inputs into outputs
Each value chain activity identifies a requirement for resources from an external supplier
The service value chain uses value streams to describe a combination of consumers and providers

questions.Name: What term is used to describe whether a service will meet availability, capacity and security requirements?
Which practice is MOST likely to benefit from the use of chatbots?
Where are the details of the required performance outcomes of a service defined?
Which value chain activity ensures a shared understanding of the current status and required direction for all products and services?
Which practice has the purpose of ensuring that the organization's suppliers and their performance are managed appropriately to support the provision of seamless, quality products and services?
What describes how components and activities work together to facilitate value creation?

Options.Name: The four dimensions of service management

questions.Name: Which two practices interact the MOST with the service desk practice?

Options.Name: Incident management and service request management
Service request management and deployment management

questions.Name: What type of change is MOST likely to be managed as a service request?
Which is a recommendation of the guiding principle 'think and work holistically'?

Options.Name: Conduct a review of existing service management practices and decide what to keep and what to discard
Review how an improvement initiative can be organized into smaller, manageable sections that can be completed in a timely manner
Review service management practices and remove any unnecessary complexity
Use the four dimensions of service management to ensure coordination of all aspects of an improvement initiative

questions.Name: Which is an activity of the 'incident management' practice?

Options.Name: Automating service requests to the greatest degree possible

questions.Name: What is the definition of a known error?

Options.Name: An unplanned interruption to a service, or reduction in the quality of a service
A cause, or potential cause, of one or more incidents
A problem that has been analysed and has not been resolved
Any change of state that has significance for the management of a service or other configuration item (CI)

questions.Name: What should be considered as part of the 'partners and suppliers' dimension?

Options.Name: The level of integration and formality involved in the relationships between organizations
The activities, workflows, controls and procedures needed to achieve the agreed objectives
The information created, managed and used in the course of service provision and consumption
The required skills and competencies of teams and individual members of the organization

questions.Name: Which benefit is MOST aligned with the guiding principle 'progress iteratively with feedback'?

Options.Name: Service providers are able to respond more quickly to customer needs
Bottlenecks in the service provider's workflow are identified
The complexities of the service provider's IT systems are identified
The service provider gains a better understanding of the customer experience

questions.Name: What aspect of 'service level management' asks service consumers what their work involves and how technology helps them?
What are guiding principles?

Options.Name: A set of interconnected activities that help an organization deliver a valuable service
A description of one or more services that help address the needs of a target consumer group
A set of specialized organizational capabilities for enabling value for customers
Recommendations that help an organization when adopting a service management approach

questions.Name: Which principle concentrates on service consumers?
Which is included in the purpose of the 'change enablement' practice?

Options.Name: Make new and changed services available for use
Ensure that risks have been properly assessed
Record and report selected changes of state
Plan and manage the full lifecycle of all IT assets

questions.Name: Which activity is part of the 'continual improvement' practice?

Options.Name: Identifying the cause of incidents and recommending related improvements
Logging and managing incidents that result in improvement opportunities
Making business cases for improvement action

questions.Name: Which is a purpose of release management?

Options.Name: To make new and changed services available for use
To move hardware and software to live environments

questions.Name: Which guiding principle discourages 'silo activity'?
Which statement about the use of measurement in the 'start where you are' guiding principle is CORRECT?

Options.Name: It should always be used to support direct observation
It should always be used instead of direct observation
Measured data is always more accurate than direct observation
The act of measuring always positively impacts results

questions.Name: Which practice ensures that any addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have an effect on services is assessed and authorized?
In which step of the 'continual improvement model' is an improvement plan implemented?
Which is the BEST example of a standard change?

Options.Name: The review and authorization of a change requested by a customer
The implementation of a critical software patch in response to a vendor security issue
The installation of a software application in response to a service request
The replacement of a component in response to a major incident

questions.Name: What varies in size and complexity, and uses functions to achieve its objectives?
Which practice involves the management of vulnerabilities that were not identified before the service went live?
What is the purpose of the 'monitoring and event management' practice?

Options.Name: To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible
To manage workarounds and known errors
To capture demand for incident resolution and service requests
To systematically observe services and service components

questions.Name:
Identify the missing word in the following sentence. 
? is the addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have a direct or indirect effect on services.
